SAYS: I just knew the area and wanted to meet people and just thought it would be the fastest way to get to know the area and just socialize.
Joining was not a difficult, right, simple.
Now that I put the app on my phone, it is much easier than the website.
I have been using this Sunday email more than I did before.
I feel like that's pretty easy to use. Yeah. Because you can find somebody's email or their phone number.
I think it would be easier to have a document that you could read and have some idea what's involved before you reach out.
THINKS: The website has not been updated in a long time, and I hope the refresh will improve the user experience.
I wish I could easily find events that interest me without scrolling through the entire calendar.
There are many features on the app that I prefer over the website, making me think the app should be the primary tool.
It's frustrating that I can't see who else is going to an event to help me decide if I want to sign up.
I feel like the organization could do better in terms of communication and accessibility of information.
DOES: Uses the website to look for events but finds it cumbersome to navigate.
Checks the app for event details and to see what events they've signed up for.
Relies on the Sunday email for event updates and reminders.
Has had to call for support when encountering issues with the website.
Looks at the members' profiles occasionally to remember names from events.
FEELS: Frustrated with the website's navigation and the need to go back multiple steps.
Happy that the app is easier to use and helps streamline event sign-ups.
Concerned about missing out on events due to unclear registration details.
Disappointed about the lack of visibility for alumni members and the difficulty in reaching out to them.
Hopeful that the website refresh will address these issues and improve the overall experience.
